TopicTitle: Kerbal Attachment System (KAS) 0.4.7 - Pipes as fuel lines and even fewer explosions!

Articles.Content:
Hey guys, new to this forum, but have been playing KSP for a year now. I know that the 64 bit version is new so I'm not going to mention the issues I'm having with it right now. I'll just wait for more stable releases, but I've been tampering with KAS trying to get it to work, even with the in official patches thy have been posted here. I've uninstalled, reinstalled the whole sha bang trying to get KAS to work. It just isn't worth it to play it without it. My temporary workaround is the fact that if attach parts to the outside of a rocket , or if I'm using b9, inside a cargo bay, I can get away without containers but it's messy. At this point, i think I'll have to wait till the official release of the next version but I thought posting this was worth a shot. What do you guys think? (Symtom: won't show up on kerbals back, won't clear from list)

I'm not sure if your problem is related to the same one I'm currently having, but after some testing it seems the only part that causes this bug for me is the radial parachute, I am not 100% sure about this but it seems to be an issue with Real Chutes since it modifies parachutes. Once I removed Real Chutes I was able to grab the chutes out of the containers, however Real Chutes is far too essential for me to play without . Guess I'll be packing parachutes in some cargo bays then, now to rescue that runaway science lab on a decaying orbit.

I'm not sure if your problem is related to the same one I'm currently having, but after some testing it seems the only part that causes this bug for me is the radial parachute, I am not 100% sure about this but it seems to be an issue with Real Chutes since it modifies parachutes. Once I removed Real Chutes I was able to grab the chutes out of the containers, however Real Chutes is far too essential for me to play without . Guess I'll be packing parachutes in some cargo bays then, now to rescue that runaway science lab on a decaying orbit.

Here is a few pictures that could help you do this. http://imgur.com/a/EkmuM#0

Thanks, but unfortunately it didn't work, I still keep getting this message infinitely inside the debug log when I try to take out a radial parachute from one of the A/B containers.

[Log]: [KAS] WaitAndGrab(Container) - Waiting rigidbody to initialize...

Not sure what else to try. Also, thanks for all you've been doing to help me and everone else out.
So I've run into an odd one and I need to know how to fix it. My kerbals are unable to take anything OUT of a container. I can put things IN, but then they're permanently stuck. Help?

So I've run into an odd one and I need to know how to fix it. My kerbals are unable to take anything OUT of a container. I can put things IN, but then they're permanently stuck. Help?

I would read through this first. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/53134-Kerbal-Attachment-System-%28KAS%29-0-4-7-Pipes-as-fuel-lines-and-even-fewer-explosions%21?p=1329791&viewfull=1#post1329791

Hey Jefferson, I'm still having issues with taking things out of containers. It may not be KAS in general because the same thing happens to LLL's containers. I've tried 3 fresh 64 bit game installs. (and yes i have been installing the game and mods correctly as you have stated step by step) Any idea where I can go to paste the errors and help me track it down? I know someone told me the debug error isn't very helpful. But this it what it says:

[Exception]: MissingMethodException: Method not found: 'Part.LoadModule'.

That's all it shows me. Thanks for your patch and hard work. It at least allows me to use the mod and completely works for most others out there.

On a side note, a few posts back I saw some talk about problems on Minmus. Sometimes when I load into my base there it begins to float up in the air about 20m and then gravity takes hold of it again. Sometimes my station doesn't land flat and topples over and things break off so I just reload and continue when it lands correctly. [Details]: Kethane drill base with KAS pipes to a rover and a fuel tanker. Only seems to do this on load in and only when pipes are connected. It could also be that I am on a slight incline. I don't really know but it is kinda weird.
Does anybody have the KAS MM for the Kerbals to be able to grab anything and not just KAS parts? If anybody has it, please re-post thx

Does anybody have the KAS MM for the Kerbals to be able to grab anything and not just KAS parts? If anybody has it, please re-post thx

i believe THIS is what ya want

Does anybody have the KAS MM for the Kerbals to be able to grab anything and not just KAS parts? If anybody has it, please re-post thx

You can achieve this by editing "addmodule" in KAS's files. Copy and paste everything from "GRAB" to "]", then change the part name to the name of the part you want to be grabable. The name will be in the part's cfg. Then edit other numbers, such as storage size to suit. Repeat until all the parts you want to grab are in there.

First try to test it on a new save with a new ship. If that doesn't work Then I would do fresh install of KAS from Majiir then install 64bit fix if your on 64bit KSP if your on 32bit KSP do the 32bit recompile.

Howdy all. So, whenever I try to grab a part off my my space station made of two large stations docked through a clamp-o-tron, everything explodes and the kerbal is launched ridiculously fast into space.

One time, grabbing from the far end from the docked port, the kerbal was thrown but the station didn't explode.

Its probably because your using Majiir's un-updated version. If you check my signature you will find links to updated versions.

If your running KSP 32bit Download the 32bit Recompile, if your running KSP 64bit download the 64bit Fix. If you are unable to get it working with the following information found in my signature let me know and I'll do my best to help you.

Hey guys, I've decided to install Linux, but before I go ahead, I was wondering if any of you might know if Linux 64bit will need the same 64bit recompile or if it will have the same problems as Windows 64 with this awesome add on.

I appreciate any responses and want to thank everyone for this work on this mod.

Its probably because your using Majiir's un-updated version. If you check my signature you will find links to updated versions.

If your running KSP 32bit Download the 32bit Recompile, if your running KSP 64bit download the 64bit Fix. If you are unable to get it working with the following information found in my signature let me know and I'll do my best to help you.

By the way, it worked fine earlier, on a somewhat simpler ship with no docked components.

Very strange,Ya try a fresh install and I will test a ship with docking ports and let you know what happens.

Very strange,Ya try a fresh install and I will test a ship with docking ports and let you know what happens.

Sure. Stupid question, by the way - how do I tell if I'm running 64 or 32? Should be 64 - running 64 bit Linux - but not certain.

Sure. Stupid question, by the way - how do I tell if I'm running 64 or 32? Should be 64 - running 64 bit Linux - but not certain.

I'm not sure about Linux 32bit or 64bit but I recall someone in another thread saying KSP was only 32bit on Linux.

I'm not sure about Linux 32bit or 64bit but I recall someone in another thread saying KSP was only 32bit on Linux.

No, it's been 64 on Linux for longer - there were some issues where you'd have to mess with Steam to get it to run 64, but I thought those went away, abd had already find them before this version, anyway.

EDIT: So, I may have found the problem. I'd forgotten about this, but when I first installed your fix it didn't do anything - no parts were added. I figured maybe it was *just* a fix, and I needed to have the old KAS in there, too, so I added that as well, and it seemed to work until this bug.

I've gone back through and removed the original KAS, replacing it with just yours, but now the parts don't load at all. So... I seem to be installing it wrong? Seeing what happens if I just replace the one .dll (which seems to be the only file in the fix.)

EDIT 2: That worked! Sorry for the confusion, and thanks for the help.

Edited August 8, 2014 by FreakyCheeseMan

EDIT 2: That worked! Sorry for the confusion, and thanks for the help.

When a fix contains just a .dll, that's generally the drill: Install the base package, then overwrite its .dll with the one from the fix.

EDIT: So, I may have found the problem. I'd forgotten about this, but when I first installed your fix it didn't do anything - no parts were added. I figured maybe it was *just* a fix, and I needed to have the old KAS in there, too, so I added that as well, and it seemed to work until this bug.

I've gone back through and removed the original KAS, replacing it with just yours, but now the parts don't load at all. So... I seem to be installing it wrong? Seeing what happens if I just replace the one .dll (which seems to be the only file in the fix.)

EDIT 2: That worked! Sorry for the confusion, and thanks for the help.

Ah ya I guess what I read was wrong. Glad it is working for you

For anyone that still might be having problems with containers and my 64bit KAS fix here is a new version that hopefully removed those rare errors. I have tested it a bit but as always take with a grain of salt.

Because circumstances will have me unable to update KAS in a timely manner, I am temporarily allowing the distribution of the KAS plugin modified for 0.24 compatibility purposes. Please do not distribute any models, textures or other art assets, and please do not distribute any part configuration files. If you'd like to balance part costs, please use a ModuleManager patch. This permission applies to the plugin only. (The KAS project has a number of contributors, and it's always a challenge to ensure all creators' rights are respected.) Please link to modifications in this thread and avoid third-party sites like Curse. (Something like Dropbox or Google Drive for hosting is fine.)

This exception shall expire as soon as I release an official update, so please bear that in mind. This is intended to allow volunteers to address compatibility issues for the players, not to otherwise grant distribution rights to the KAS plugin.

In no way is this an official patch or in any way representing Majiir.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/0f4x4xcu2drbmkp/KAS_64bit_24_3.zip

To fix grabbing radial parachutes from containers follow this tutorial here http://imgur.com/a/EkmuM#0

Hey, I'm having that same issue. Can't get anything out of a container. "Take" button doesn't do anything.

Same issue here. New release, all updated dll's from the link and its 32 bit. The Kerbals just refuse to take anything out. :\

As said before, kas is mostly working for me in 32bit. But recently the eva struts dont work anymore. I can take them from the container, but i cannot attach them to anything.

The rest is working ncely for me with the newest updates, thanx!

Same issue here. New release, all updated dll's from the link and its 32 bit. The Kerbals just refuse to take anything out. :\

Allot of people have been having issue installing the fix with KAS.

First download this(Its Majiirs KAS) https://nabaal.net/files/ksp/KAS_v0.4.7.zip

Extract the GameData folder from the zip file^ into your KerbalSpaceProgram directory( you can find this location by right click on the launch icon and selection open file location OR through STEAM right click on Kerbal Space Program and select properties then select local files and next click on browse local files)

After that you need to download my KAS fix or KAS recompile depending on if you are playing KSP 32bit or KSP 64bit. You can check this by look to the bottom right while KSP is running at the main menu.

If you are running 32bit KSP download this https://www.dropbox.com/s/qgp9a06n2k2pq2d/KAS32bitRecompile.zip and do the same as we did before extract the GameData folder from the zip to the Kerbal Space Program directory and override what it ask.

If you are running 64bit KSP download this https://www.dropbox.com/s/4kaie9rnpio42r8/KAS_64bit_24_2.zip and same again extract the GameData folder from the zip to Kerbal Space Program directory and override what it ask.

For 64bit only if the above version is messing up with containers try this version https://www.dropbox.com/s/0f4x4xcu2drbmkp/KAS_64bit_24_3.zip

I hope this resolves the issue for you but if not I would check the last few pages and see if anything posted might help you.

As said before, kas is mostly working for me in 32bit. But recently the eva struts dont work anymore. I can take them from the container, but i cannot attach them to anything.

The rest is working ncely for me with the newest updates, thanx!

I'm sorry I must have missed that post, I will investigate now and I'm very sorry that I haven't addressed it until now. I will reply back with my findings.

@Smart013 the struts seem to be working fine. It takes some position of the strut ends sometimes to get them to work but they do.
